ygData.subject: RE: (OT) Vodka recipe (was: RE: bards agi & dodge)
ygData.msgSnippet: Forgive me venturing a bit to far into the trade talk, but just for the sake of random bard knowledge to share with my friends here on the list, I got ahold of
ygData.messageBody:
Forgive me venturing a bit to far into the trade talk, but just for the sake
of random bard knowledge to share with my friends here on the list, I got
ahold of the vodka recipe a couple days ago and tried it out (brewing skill
is only at about 20 now) and failed due insufficient skill in 9 attempts.
The funny thing and the point of the message is that each time I failed, the
product of combining the items necessary was an empty shot glass which is
not one of the original components of the recipe.

I think I have discovered a new skill.

Faras "the glass blower" Tar'Linedhel

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Snicker Furfoot, Esq. [mailto:snicker@...]
> Sent: Friday, August 27, 1999 5:03 PM
> To: eqbards@onelist.com
> Subject: (OT) Vodka recipe (was: RE: [eqbards] bards agi & dodge)
>
>
> From: "Snicker Furfoot, Esq." <snicker@...>
>
> At 11:51 AM 8/27/99 -1000, you wrote:
> >From: "Reece, Tom - 25IDL G4" <g4mntofcr@...>
> >With that said, everyone knows that not everything in EQ is
> logical. Case
> >in point is the vodka recipe that is the current hot topic
> on the brewers
> >list. People have been trying for weeks to discover this
> recipe. All kinds
> >of logical ingredient combinations were tried. This week
> the recipe was
> >discovered/leaked by Verant. One of the ingredients for
> vodka is short
> >beer. No way in hell would anyone ever think to include
> beer as part of a
> >recipe for vodka. I'm sure there are other examples out there.
>
> Um.... *cough* (from a vodka-distillation page)
> "The scale of operation is one where 10 kg of sugar per batch
> are fermented
> to a crude "beer"
> which is then distilled to yield 11 liters of 40% vodka."
>
> I have a feeling that's where the idea came from...
>
> Talies
